src:
Forma Prevcev še vedno niha
Slovenski smučarski skakalci pilijo formo na ledeni smučini v Zakopanah. Timi Zajc in Anže Lanišek med našimi še zmeraj najbolj stanovitna.
07 Nov 2019, 06:20 by Miha Šimnovec
LJUBLJANA – Najboljši slovenski smučarski skakalci se mudijo v Zakopanah, kjer pilijo formo za bližnji začetek nove sezone svetovnega pokala, nad katero se bo zastor čez 15 dni dvignil v Visli. Na 140-metrski napravi Wielka Krokiew, ki ima že lep čas ledeno zaletno smučino, vadijo vsi člani naših reprezentanc A, mlade A in B (skupaj 15), uvodni trening na tamkajšnji skakalnici pa so izvedli v torek.»Po prvih skokih v Zakopanah je splošni vtis soliden ali povprečen, vendar moram povedati, da so bile zaradi močnega dežja razmere za skakanje zares zahtevne,« je razkril glavni trener Gorazd Bertoncelj in pristavil, da so pred odhodom na jug Poljske dva treninga na ledeni smučini opravili tudi na 110-metrski napravi v Kranju. Po pripravah v Zakopanah bo selektor dokončno določil ekipo, s katero se bo čez dva tedna podal v lov na točke svetovnega pokala. Večjih presenečenj ni pričakovati, jedro moštva bodo tvorili fantje, ki so prednjačili že v letošnji veliki nagradi Mednarodne smučarske zveze (FIS). V poletno-jesenski različici svetovnega pokala sta se od slovenskih skakalcev v najlepši luči predstavila Timi Zajc in Anže Lanišek, ki sta v skupni razvrstitvi končala na tretjem oziroma 16. mestu, oba sta v tem tekmovanju okusila tudi slast zmage. Zajc je bil najboljši v Visli in Courchevelu, Lanišek pa je vso konkurenco pustil za seboj na finalu v Klingenthalu. Oba še zdaj med našimi orli skačeta najbolj stanovitno.
Bartol, Jelar in Justin z bolečinami
»Da, Timi in Anže odstopata od drugih,« je potrdil Bertoncelj in glede Petra Prevca, ki je kot tretji najboljši Slovenec v seštevku velike nagrade pristal na 19. mestu, dejal, da njegova forma še vedno niha. »Kaže solidne in slabše skoke, res pa je, da je v zadnjem obdobju več stabilnih in manj ponesrečenih,« je glavni trener povedal o pripravljenosti skupnega zmagovalca svetovnega pokala iz sezone 2015/16. Na vprašanje, kako skače najmlajši od bratov Prevc, je odvrnil, da je tudi Domnovo skakanje spremenljivo. A je vseeno na višji ravni kot v istem lanskem obdobju, ko je – ker se še ni počutil dovolj pripravljenega – izpustil uvodno postajo v Visli.Skrb vzbujajo bolečine, ki jih v kolenu čuti Tilen Bartol, lažje poškodovan je Žiga Jelar, bolečine v zadnjem obdobju spremljajo tudi Roka Justina, ki je z uspešnimi predstavami v celinskem pokalu slovenskemu zastopstvu priskakal sedmo kvoto za nastope v prvem ciklusu svetovnega pokala 2019/20. »Upam, da z nikomer ni nič hujšega,« si je zaželel 43-letni Kranjčan, ki si je za uvodni preizkušnji v Visli (23. in 24. novembra) zastavil sorazmerno visoke cilje. »Upam, da nam bo uspel spodbuden start, saj bi bilo potem nadaljevanje zagotovo lažje. Nadejam se, da se bomo na moštveni tekmi borili za stopničke (lani se je morala slovenska četverica sprijazniti s sedmim mestom – op. p.), na posamični pa bi imel rad dva fanta med deseterico in še dva do 20. mesta,« je svoja pričakovanja razgrnil Bertoncelj.
text:
The Prevci form is still fluctuating
Slovenian ski jumpers are taking shape on an ice ski in Zakopane. Timi Zajc and Anže Lanišek are still among our most persistent.
07 Nov 2019, 06:20 by Miha Šimnovec
LJUBLJANA - The best Slovenian ski jumpers are in Zakopane, where they are piling on the form for the upcoming start of the new World Cup season, over which the curtain will rise in Visla in 15 days. On the 140-meter Wielka Krokiew device, which has an ice-cold skiing moment in time, all members of our national teams A, young A and B (15 in total) practice, and their initial training was held on Tuesday. »After the first jump in Zakopane the overall impression is solid or mediocre, but I have to say that the heavy rain made the jumping conditions really challenging, "revealed head coach Gorazd Bertoncelj, saying that before going south to Poland, they also did 110 ice skis. meter device in Kranj. Following the preparations in Zakopane, the coach will finally determine the team to go hunting for the World Cup points in two weeks. No major surprises are to be expected; the core of the team will be the guys who took the lead in this year's FIS Grand Prix. In the summer and autumn versions of the World Cup, Timi Zajc and Anže Lanišek presented themselves in the most beautiful light of the Slovenian jumpers, who finished third and 16th in the overall ranking, respectively, and both tasted the delight of victory in this competition. Rabbit was the best in Wisla and Courchevel, and Lanišek left all the competition behind him at the Klingenthal Final. Both of us are still rocking most of our eagles.
Bartol, Jelar and Justin with pain
"Yes, Timi and Anze deviate from the others," Bertoncelj confirmed, referring to Peter Prevec, who came in 19th place as the third best Slovenian in the grand prize, saying that his form was still fluctuating. "He is showing solid and worse jumps, but it is true that there are more stable and less injured in the recent period," the head coach said of the readiness of the joint winner of the 2015/16 World Cup. When asked how the youngest of the Prevc brothers jumps, he said that Domno's jumping is also variable. However, it is still at a higher level than in the same period last year, when - because he was not yet ready enough - he dropped the introductory station at Wisla. They also accompany Rok Justin, who, with successful performances in the Continental Cup, was pushing the seventh quota for Slovenian performances in the first round of the 2019/20 World Cup. "I hope there is nothing worse for anyone," wished the 43-year-old Carniolan, who set himself relatively high goals for the introductory trials in Wisla (November 23-24). “I hope that we will have a stimulating start, because then it would certainly be easier to continue. I hope we will compete for the podium in the team race (last year the Slovenian four had to face the seventh place), and I would like to have two boys in the singles between ten and two to 20, ” Bertoncelj expressed his expectations.
